content.text:
The 64-year-old man is with a 20-year history of liver cirrhosis. The post-enhancement arterial phase is shown in <image 1>. The most likely diagnosis is?

A. aortic dissection
B. liver cancer
C. liver abscess
D. Liver adenoma

The image provided is a computed tomography (CT) scan of the liver, showing a 64-year-old man with a 20-year history of liver cirrhosis. The post-enhancement arterial phase of the scan is shown.

The most likely diagnosis based on the CT scan is:

C. liver abscess

This is because liver abscesses are typically seen as fluid-filled spaces within the liver, which is consistent with the findings in the CT scan.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
